headline: Nvidia Shares Surge on Big Tech’s $650 Billion AI-Spending Plan
summary: Shares of the chipmaker rose as much as 7.7%, the biggest intraday jump since April 9, adding more than $300 billion in market value.  Amazon.com Inc. sparked the rebound after the technology giant said during an earnings call that it plans to spend $200 billion on data centers, chips and other equipment this year.  All told, Amazon, along with Alphabet Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., are expected to shell out roughly $650 billion for AI tools in 2026, about 60% more than the prior year.

headline: Seagate CEO Share Sale Raises Questions On Valuation And AI Expectations
summary: Seagate Technology Holdings CEO executed a sizable insider share sale shortly after the company reported strong operational performance and quarterly results. The transaction comes as industry attention is focused on AI driven demand for high capacity storage drives and a perceived memory supercycle. Investors are watching the sale closely for clues about management sentiment toward NasdaqGS:STX at a current share price of $405.45. For context, NasdaqGS:STX is trading at $405.45, after a...

headline: 5 Growth Stocks to Buy in February to Enhance Your Portfolio Returns
summary: MU, MDB, APH, CIEN and STX are leading a February growth-stock list as AI-driven memory demand and strong earnings growth lift prospects.
